text.p: These are the leading stories in the Skopje press on Friday. Reuters has not verified them nor does it vouch for their accuracy.
- Macedonian President Kiro Gligorov visited military academy Goce Delcev in Skopje on Thursday where he was informed on combatt readiness and equipment of the army.
- Robert Corker, head of the International Monetary Fund mission in Skopje, said the Macedonian government was implementing economic reforms as agreed with the Fund.
- Last year was a relatively calm year for Macedonia, but social unrest could be expected this year, the paper said in its commentary.
- The Independent trade unions of Macedonia called for a workers' protest march next Monday due to unbearably low standard of living.
